intro: Paepalanthus glandulifer, commonly known as the glandular paepalanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, glandular structures on its leaves and stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
